title: Four Seasons in administration: what happens if my care home goes bust?
text:
I’ve been reading the news about the increasing number of care homes being closed each year and it’s got me worried.

My mother lives at a home operated by a large provider. The company’s financial difficulties have been well publicised which has me a little nervous.

What would happen to my mother if the company goes into liquidation and her home is closed?

HT, Worcestershire

Four Seasons has become the largest care home provider since 2011 to go into administration. With 17,000 residents across 322 homes it is the biggest firm of its kind since Southern Cross to hit serious financial difficulty.

The number of residential care businesses going bust has soared in recent years, with 148 closing...
